Description: Optimization problem where the objective function and constraints are all linear. Highly efficient solvers exist.
Example: Resource allocation, production planning, transportation problems

Description: Similar to LP but with some or all decision variables required to be integers.
A combination of LP and IP â€“ some variables are continuous, some are integer.
Optimization problem where either the objective function or constraints are nonlinear.
Optimization problem where the objective function and feasible region are convex. Efficient solvers exist for many convex problems.
Solving a complex problem by breaking it down into smaller overlapping subproblems.
Finding an optimal object from a finite set of objects.
Optimization under uncertainty, where some parameters are random variables.
A type of non-linear optimization where the objective and constraints can be expressed in a specific form.
Solvability: Can be efficiently solved in some cases

Description: Optimization problem where the objective function is quadratic and the constraints are linear.
